node.background: The death of George Floyd ignited conversation about racism in America and in the campaign, forcing the candidates to draft plans for how to address inequities and structural barriers for people of color.
node.questionText: What policies do you support putting in place to address systemic racism?
node.longAnswer: Hickenlooper released an “equity for all” plan that calls for improving access to health care for people of color, as well as investing in education; supporting entrepreneurs of color; addressing police brutality; and reforming Colorado’s criminal justice system. He said he would support the Health Equity and Accountability Act to address the health of minority populations. He also supports reparations for African-Americans.
node.candidateInfo: Former Colorado governor and Denver mayor

node.background: The death of George Floyd ignited conversation about racism in America and in the campaign, forcing the candidates to draft plans for how to address inequities and structural barriers for people of color.
node.questionText: What policies do you support putting in place to address systemic racism?
node.longAnswer: Romanoff released a plan to address systemic racism by creating an equitable justice system that calls for strengthening the enforcement of federal civil rights laws. He also released a detailed proposal to increase police accountability that includes the elimination of racial profiling. He supports reducing funding for police departments and diverting the money to other community programs. He also supports reparations for African-Americans and indigenous people.
node.candidateInfo: Former state House speaker and director Mental Health Colorado
